page.title: 04Sunninglye Farm
page.content: The farmer here has 360 sheep, 54 bullocks, 8 horses and 10 chickens. The{lambs}with black faces have Suffolk rams as fathers; those with white faces have Texel rams. He grows 18.5 acres of pennyhalf or winter oats and 80 acres of grass for hay. In his barn there is room for 7000 bales of{hay.} The farm was originally part of{Bayham Estate,}but the farmer bought it and he works it by himself. He has 3{tractors,}a combine harvester, a hay baler and an assortment of ploughs and trailers. The farmer owns 161 acres{(64 {hectares)}of land. There has been a farm on this site for over 900 years and it was probably registered in William the Conqueror's Domesday Book. The area is covered with fields and deciduous trees.
